messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/admin/users/{user}` with method PUT, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\UserController` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/admin/users/{user}` with HTTP method PUT.

2. In `app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php`, `UserController` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/admin/users/{user}` with HTTP method PUT.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Explanation (step-by-step):

1. Route and controller:
   - routes/admin.php registers Route::resource('users', UserController::class)->only(['index', 'edit', 'update']); so the update action is mapped to PUT /admin/users/{user}.
   - app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController::update accepts UsersRequest $request and User $user (route model binding). This establishes a required path parameter named "user" (the user id).

2. Validation and expected input fields:
   - The request validation is defined in app/Http/Requests/Admin/UsersRequest.php:
     - 'name' => required, string, max:255, new AlphaName (so name is required).
     - 'email' => required|email|unique:users,email,{$this->user->id} (so email is required).
     - 'password' => nullable|confirmed (password is optional; if provided must be confirmed with password_confirmation).
     - 'roles.*' => exists:roles,id (roles is an array of role ids; elements must exist in roles table).
   - In controller update: $user->update(array_filter($request->only(['name','email','password']))); and $role_ids = array_values($request->get('roles', [])); $user->roles()->sync($role_ids);
     - This indicates the request expects 'name', 'email', optional 'password' (with matching password_confirmation), and an array 'roles' of role IDs (roles[]).

3. Parameter modeling for Swagger 2.0:
   - The path parameter "user" is required and is an integer identifier (int64).
   - The payload is sent via typical HTML form submission (application/x-www-form-urlencoded), so formData parameters are appropriate for each input field.
   - For the roles array, Swagger 2.0 represents arrays in formData with "type": "array", an "items" object and "collectionFormat": "multi" to allow repeated form fields (roles[]=1&roles[]=2 or roles=1&roles=2).

The final generated result begins
[
  {
    "name": "user",
    "in": "path",
    "description": "ID of the user to update (route model binding)",
    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int64"
  },
  {
    "name": "name",
    "in": "formData",
    "description": "User full name (required, string, max 255, AlphaName rule)",
    "required": true,
    "type": "string",
    "maxLength": 255
  },
  {
    "name": "email",
    "in": "formData",
    "description": "User email address (required, must be unique among users except the current user)",
    "required": true,
    "type": "string",
    "format": "email"
  },
  {
    "name": "password",
    "in": "formData",
    "description": "Password (optional). If provided it must be confirmed using password_confirmation; the controller will hash the password before storing.",
    "required": false,
    "type": "string",
    "format": "password"
  },
  {
    "name": "password_confirmation",
    "in": "formData",
    "description": "Password confirmation (required when password is provided)",
    "required": false,
    "type": "string",
    "format": "password"
  },
  {
    "name": "roles",
    "in": "formData",
    "description": "Array of role IDs to assign to the user. Provide multiple values with repeated parameter names (collectionFormat: multi).",
    "required": false,
    "type": "array",
    "items": {
      "type": "integer",
      "format": "int64"
    },
    "collectionFormat": "multi"
  }
]
